climbs.name: The Zipper
climbs.fa: Josh Gross and Sam Lightner Jr.

content.location: Far left end of The Scar.

content.description: Follow first two bolts of  Staph then break right on good flakes to a clip in anchor. Going beyond the first anchor is The Butterfly at .13a.

climbs.name: Sunkist
climbs.fa: Tom Perkins, Shelly Malkin,  and Josh Gross

content.description: The route begins on the approach ledge to The Scar. Climb through a series of bulges to a good anchor.

climbs.name: Sub-Lux
climbs.fa: Sam Lightner and Josh Gross and Jason Keith

content.description: Do a series of boulder problems between total rests to an anchor shared with Pockmarks.

climbs.name: Staph
climbs.fa: Josh Gross, Lynn Sanson, and Sam Lightner Jr.

content.description: CLIMB TO A SERIOUS BOULDER PROBLEM AND CLIP THE ANCHOR
Kinda Shitty. Move up and do a wierd boulder problem, then a few fun bolts of climbing to an anchor shared by Sub Lux.

The project listed in Karl's book and on the cover photo on The Scars front page (on MP). Pull stacked boulder problems separated by good rests followed by sustained .11 climbing to the chains. The name may help identifying crucial beta.

Originally rated .13b maybe it has gotten easier or helps to be tall. I thought it was 12d so I'll settle on 13a until others have tried it.  It's a good one though - I'm not sure which is better Knee Scar or Extended Care.
content.protection: Stick clipping may be a good idea.
content.location: Just right of Zipper and left of The Flapper

content.description:
A nice, harder route close to town.  Shares the anchors with Extended Care.  Stick clip the first bolt, it's high and not easy getting there.

Pull some relatively hard moves until you get a break before the crux in between the first and second bolt.  Crux is moving left off what I assume is the Hot Popsicle hold, a sloping, open handed flat/pinch hold that you won't want to be using if it's hot out.  Move left into good sidepulls and up to the 'ear' and a flat hold for a shake.  From here some height dependent crimping gets you joined with Extended Care.  Easier climbing to a tricky boulder problem right before the anchors.
content.protection: 8-10 Draws.  Stick clip the first bolt, also I extended the second bolt with a shoulder length to do the crux move.
content.location: Right of Eviscerate and Extended Care about 15 ft.  Nicely painted orange hangers

content.description: Follow the fold/flake to chain anchors. Like 6 quickdraws are all thats needed.

climbs.name: Extended Care
climbs.fa: Josh Gross and Sam Lightner Jr.

content.description: Climb up the first 4 bolts of Eviscerate and then taverse right and up to a chain anchor
Start left then climb straight up to the anchor shared with Tender to the Touch. Powerful.

climbs.name: The Butterfly
climbs.fa: Josh Gross and Sam Lightner Jr.

content.description: Climb Tender to the Touch and then continue up and right on good holds to a chain anchor.
